title: Ultraconformable cuff implants for long-term bidirectional interfacing of peripheral nerves at sub-nerve resolutions
description: Dataset and code from a study demonstrating high-resolution, chronic peripheral nerve recording and stimulation using ultraconformable cuff implants in awake rats.
full_description: This dataset originates from a study on ultraconformable nerve cuff implants designed for long-term, bidirectional interfacing with peripheral nerves in freely-moving rats. The implants were evaluated over 21 days, enabling chronic recording of fascicle-specific nerve activity and modulation of paw movement. The study also included a partial nerve ligation model to characterize C fibre activity changes linked to neuropathic pain. Data includes electrophysiological recordings, kinematic measurements, and histological analyses. The cuffs demonstrated improved biocompatibility and reduced fibrotic response compared to PDMS silicone cuffs.
